intro: Leucosyke ochroneura, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes many plants with fragrant leaves and fruits. The plant is characterized by its silvery-white undersides on its leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by small, round fruits. The tree is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
